name: seediness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of looking dirty or in bad condition and likely to be involved in dishonest or illegal activities: The cinema has a certain seediness left over from when it was a strip club. See
seedy
More examplesFewer examplesThe appeal of casinos is that there's some glamour and some seediness.The blight of unwanted buildings has infected virtually every street, creating an air of seediness.They loved his cool, his on-screen cruelty, his seediness. It seems unable to shake off its image of seaside seediness.
